greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of endofunctions f on [2n] satisfying f^k(i) = i for all i in [n]; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..70, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, k, p) local l, g; l, g:= sort([divisors(p)[]]),
proc(k, m, i, t) option remember; local d, j; d:= l[i];
mathematica: b[n_, k0_, p_] := Module[{l, g}, l = Divisors[p];
g[k_, m_, i_, t_] := g[k, m, i, t] = Module[{d, j}, d = l[[i]];
If[i == 1, If[m == 0, 1, n^m], Sum[M[k, Join[{k - (d - t)*j},
Array[t&, j]]]*g[k - (d - t)*j, m - t*j, Sequence @@
Table[A[n, d - n], {d, 0, 10}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 27 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_, updated Jan 01 2021 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 12 2014
